titles.title: In evil long I took delight

properties.verseOrder: v1 v2 v3 v4 v5 v6 v7 v8

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: {lang-eng}In evil long I took delight, Unawed by shame or fear, Till a new object struck my sight, And stopped my wild career.{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: {lang-eng}I saw One hanging on a tree, In agony and blood, Who fixed His languid eyes on me, As near His cross I stood.{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v3
v4
verse.lines: {lang-eng}My conscience felt and owned the guilt, And plunged me in despair, I saw my sins His blood had spilt, And helped to nail Him there.{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v5
v6
v7
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Thus, while His death my sin displays, In all its blackest hue, Such is the mystery of grace, It seals my pardon too.{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v8
